alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued June 13 at 5:49AM MDT until June 13 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .Periods of moderate rainfall will bring the potential for flash flooding and debris flows across and downstream of the Robertson Draw burn area. Rain will end later today bringing an end to the flash flood threat. ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE ROBERTSON DRAW BURN AREA NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Robertson Draw Burn Area. * WHERE...A portion of south central Montana, including the following county, Carbon. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Moderate rainfall over the Robertson Draw Burn Area is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Robertson Draw Burn Area should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Excessive rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, and debris flows in and near the Robertson Draw wildfire burn scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting moderate rainfall over the Robertson Draw Burn Area, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
